greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tetrangle where T(n,H(u),H(v)) is the coefficient of p(v) in F(u), where u and v are integer partitions of n, H is Heinz number, p is power sum symmetric functions, and F is augmented forgotten symmetric functions.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
The augmented forgotten symmetric functions are given by F(y) = c(y) * f(y) where f is forgotten symmetric functions and c(y) = Product_i (y)_i!, where (y)_i is the number of i's in y.
example: For example, row 14 gives: F(32) = -p(5) - p(32).
xref: Row sums are A178803. Up to sign, same as A321931. This is a regrouping of the triangle A321899.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 23 2018
